oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Habits of the Bat and the Porcupine, etc. By Dia!kwain, from his parents (L V.-6. 4378-4403).What Dia!kwain's parents told him about the bat and the porcupine who inhabit the same hole and go about together seeking food. 1) This story was told to Dia!kwain by his father (Xaa-ttin) and his mother (=kamme-an); four names for the porcupine used by the |xam, the Dutch and |xam girls, 2) pp.4377v-4401v all contain notes and stories relating to beliefs and doings: see Things girls and youths must avoid (the rain's things) and A note about the porcupine , 3) This story is found in Book V-6.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A belief about the bat and the porcupine
